text: George Hoyt Whipple (August 26, 1878 - February 1, 1976) was an American Medical doctor and scientist. He won the 1934 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine, along with George Minot and William P. Murphy, for their discoveries about how eating liver could cure anaemia. ==References== Category:1878 births Category:1976 deaths Category:Johns Hopkins University faculty Category:American Nobel Prize winners Category:American physicians Category:Scientists from New Hampshire Category:Yale University alumni
title: George Whipple
